description:
Here’s my take on NGC 6188 or better known as “The Fighting Dragons of Ara”. 
This was my first dive into the world of SHO imaging.

Some details about the image:
I used a few different focus lengths to capture this image. Most of the data was captured using a wide field scopes (530mm & 680mm), while the center region was taken at 2249mm to enhance the resolution of this area. The stacked wide field and longer focal length images were blended in photoshop and then processed.

Center Region: 
HA 6x10min
OIII 5x10min

Wide Field:
HA 22x10min
OIII 27x10min
SII 13x10min

Total integration: 12hrs

Telescopes, Cameras and Filters:
T8 (Takahashi FSQ106 EDX) & T9 (Tele Vue NP127FLI Refractor)
Camera = FLI Microline 16803

T31 (Planewave 20" (0.51m) CDK)
Camera = FLI-PL09000 

Filters = AstroDon Series 2
HA, OIII, SII

Software: AstroPixel Processor,  Photoshop
title: NGC 6188: The Fighting Dragons of Ara
